intro: Thyrsanthus fasciculatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thyrsin, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, and its growth form is usually shrub-like with multiple stems. Thyrsanthus fasciculatus is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
